langchain_community.cache.CassandraSemanticCacheÂ¶

class langchain_community.cache.CassandraSemanticCache(session: Optional[CassandraSession], keyspace: Optional[str], embedding: Embeddings, table_name: str = 'langchain_llm_semantic_cache', distance_metric: str = 'dot', score_threshold: float = 0.85, ttl_seconds: Optional[int] = None, skip_provisioning: bool = False)[source]Â¶

Cache that uses Cassandra as a vector-store backend for semantic (i.e. similarity-based) lookup.

It uses a single (vector) Cassandra table and stores, in principle, cached values from several LLMs, so the LLMâ€™s llm_string is part of the rowsâ€™ primary keys.

The similarity is based on one of several distance metrics (default: â€œdotâ€). If choosing another metric, the default threshold is to be re-tuned accordingly.

Initialize the cache with all relevant parameters. :param session: an open Cassandra session :type session: cassandra.cluster.Session :param keyspace: the keyspace to use for storing the cache :type keyspace: str :param embedding: Embedding provider for semantic

encoding and search.

Parameters

  • table_name (str) â€“ name of the Cassandra (vector) table to use as cache

  • distance_metric (str, 'dot') â€“ which measure to adopt for similarity searches

  • score_threshold (optional float) â€“ numeric value to use as cutoff for the similarity searches

  • ttl_seconds (optional int) â€“ time-to-live for cache entries (default: None, i.e. forever)

  • session (Optional[CassandraSession]) â€“

  • keyspace (Optional[str]) â€“

  • embedding (Embedding) â€“

  • skip_provisioning (bool) â€“

The default score threshold is tuned to the default metric. Tune it carefully yourself if switching to another distance metric.

Methods

Initialize the cache with all relevant parameters. :param session: an open Cassandra session :type session: cassandra.cluster.Session :param keyspace: the keyspace to use for storing the cache :type keyspace: str :param embedding: Embedding provider for semantic encoding and search. :type embedding: Embedding :param table_name: name of the Cassandra (vector) table to use as cache :type table_name: str :param distance_metric: which measure to adopt for similarity searches :type distance_metric: str, 'dot' :param score_threshold: numeric value to use as cutoff for the similarity searches :type score_threshold: optional float :param ttl_seconds: time-to-live for cache entries (default: None, i.e. forever) :type ttl_seconds: optional int.

clear(**kwargs)

Clear the whole semantic cache.

delete_by_document_id(document_id)

Given this is a "similarity search" cache, an invalidation pattern that makes sense is first a lookup to get an ID, and then deleting with that ID.

delete_by_document_id(document_id: str) → None[source]Â¶

Given this is a â€œsimilarity searchâ€ cache, an invalidation pattern that makes sense is first a lookup to get an ID, and then deleting with that ID. This is for the second step.
